meanings.definition: A type of marsupial native to Australia.
meanings.sent1: The coalas in the zoo were sleeping in the trees.
meanings.sent2: I saw a family of coalas while hiking in Australia.
meanings.sent3: The children at the costume party dressed up as coalas.
meanings.sent4: Her fluffy coat made her look like a koala, a coalas in human form.
meanings.sent5: The coalas' round ears and fuzzy bodies make them easy to recognize.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'koala'.
meanings.sent1: There are many coalas at the wildlife sanctuary.
meanings.sent2: The coalas in the picture look adorable.
meanings.sent3: The store had a sale on stuffed coalas.
meanings.sent4: The coalas on the poster seemed to come to life.
meanings.sent5: The children counted the coalas in the book one by one.

meanings.definition: The act of resembling or imitating a koala.
meanings.sent1: Her playful movements were like those of a coalas.
meanings.sent2: The actor's performance was a perfect coalas.
meanings.sent3: The dance routine included a funny coalas impression.
meanings.sent4: His laziness was compared to that of a coalas.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's joke about being a coalas made everyone laugh.
